sentence.text: AZOR (amlodipine besylate and olmesartan medoxomil) tablet, film coated
Azor is indicated for the treatment of hypertension, alone or with other antihypertensive agents , to lower blood pressure.
Do not co-administer aliskiren with Azor in patients with diabetes [See Drug Interactions].
Patients with an activated renin-angiotensin system, such as volume- and/or salt-depleted patients (e.g., those being treated with high doses of diuretics) may be particularly vulnerable.

mmtx.phraseText: Patients with an activated renin-angiotensin system,
treated with high doses of diuretics

sentence.text: Since the vasodilation attributable to amlodipine in Azor is gradual in onset, acute hypotension has rarely been reported after oral administration.

mmtx.phraseText: the vasodilation attributable to amlodipine in Azor
the vasodilation attributable to amlodipine in Azor

sentence.text: Nonetheless, exercise caution, as with any other peripheral vasodilator, when administering Azor, particularly in patients with severe aortic stenosis.
The pharmacokinetics of amlodipine and olmesartan medoxomil are not altered when the drugs are co-administered.

No drug interaction studies have been conducted with Azor and other drugs, although studies have been conducted with the individual amlodipine and olmesartan medoxomil components of Azor, as described below, and no significant drug interactions have been observed.
In vitro data indicate that amlodipine has no effect on the human plasma protein binding of digoxin, phenytoin, warfarin, and indomethacin.

mmtx.phraseText: no effect on the human plasma protein binding of digoxin,
no effect on the human plasma protein binding of digoxin,

sentence.text: Cimetidine: Co-administration of amlodipine with cimetidine did not alter the pharmacokinetics of amlodipine.
Grapefruit juice: Co-administration of 240 mL of grapefruit juice with a single oral dose of amlodipine 10 mg in 20 healthy volunteers had no significant effect on the pharmacokinetics of amlodipine.

mmtx.phraseText: no significant effect on the pharmacokinetics of amlodipine.
Co-administration of 240 mL of grapefruit juice

sentence.text: Maalox (antacid): Co-administration of the antacid Maalox with a single dose of amlodipine had no significant effect on the pharmacokinetics of amlodipine.

mmtx.phraseText: no significant effect on the pharmacokinetics of amlodipine.

sentence.text: Sildenafil: A single 100 mg dose of sildenafil in subjects with essential hypertension had no effect on the pharmacokinetic parameters of amlodipine.

mmtx.phraseText: A single 100 mg dose of sildenafil
no effect on the pharmacokinetic parameters of amlodipine.

sentence.text: When amlodipine and sildenafil were used in combination, each agent independently exerted its own blood pressure lowering effect.
Atorvastatin: Co-administration of multiple 10 mg doses of amlodipine with 80 mg of atorvastatin resulted in no significant change in the steady state pharmacokinetic parameters of atorvastatin.

mmtx.phraseText: Co-administration of multiple 10 mg doses of amlodipine

sentence.text: Digoxin: Co-administration of amlodipine with digoxin did not change serum digoxin levels or digoxin renal clearance in normal volunteers.

mmtx.phraseText: digoxin renal clearance in normal volunteers.

sentence.text: Warfarin: Co-administration of amlodipine with warfarin did not change the warfarin prothrombin response time.
Simvastatin: Co-administration of multiple doses of 10 mg of amlodipine with 80 mg simvastatin resulted in a 77% increase in exposure to simvastatin compared to simvastatin alone.

mmtx.phraseText: Co-administration of multiple doses of 10 mg of amlodipine

sentence.text: Limit the dose of simvastatin in patients on amlodipine to 20 mg daily.

In clinical trials, amlodipine has been safely administered with thiazide diuretics, beta-blockers, angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors, long-acting nitrates, sublingual nitroglycerin, digoxin, warfarin, non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, antibiotics, and oral hypoglycemic drugs.
Non-Steroidal Anti-Inflammatory Agents including Selective Cyclooxygenase-2 Inhibitors (COX-2 Inhibitors)

In patients who are elderly, volume-depleted (including those on diuretic therapy), or with compromised renal function, co-administration of NSAIDs, including selective COX-2 inhibitors, with angiotensin II receptor antagonists, including olmesartan medoxomil, may result in deterioration of renal function, including possible acute renal failure.
Monitor renal function periodically in patients receiving olmesartan medoxomil and NSAID therapy.
The antihypertensive effect of angiotensin II receptor antagonists, including olmesartan medoxomil may be attenuated by NSAIDs including selective COX-2 inhibitors.

mmtx.phraseText: The antihypertensive effect of angiotensin II receptor antagonists,

sentence.text: No significant drug interactions were reported in studies in which olmesartan medoxomil was co-administered with digoxin or warfarin in healthy volunteers.
The bioavailability of olmesartan medoxomil was not significantly altered by the co-administration of antacids [Al(OH)3/Mg(OH)2].

mmtx.phraseText: altered by the co-administration of antacids

sentence.text: Dual Blockade of the Renin-Angiotensin System (RAS)

mmtx.phraseText: Dual Blockade of the Renin-Angiotensin System
Dual Blockade of the Renin-Angiotensin System

sentence.text: Dual blockade of the RAS with angiotensin receptor blockers, ACE inhibitors, or aliskiren is associated with increased risks of hypotension, hyperkalemia, and changes in renal function (including acute renal failure) compared to monotherapy.

ellipsisSentence.text: Olmesartan medoxomil is not metabolized by the cytochrome P450 system and has no effects on P450 enzymes;

middleSentence.text: thus, interactions with drugs that inhibit, induce, or are metabolized by those enzymes are not expected.
Dual Blockade of the Renin-Angiotensin System (RAS)

ellipsisSentence.text: Olmesartan medoxomil is not metabolized by the cytochrome P450 system and has no effects on P450 enzymes;

middleSentence.text: thus, interactions with drugs that inhibit, induce, or are metabolized by those enzymes are not expected.

ellipsisSentence.text: Olmesartan medoxomil is not metabolized by the cytochrome P450 system and has no effects on P450 enzymes;

Dual Blockade of the Renin-Angiotensin System (RAS)

ellipsisSentence.text: Olmesartan medoxomil is not metabolized by the cytochrome P450 system and has no effects on P450 enzymes;

middleSentence.text: thus, interactions with drugs that inhibit, induce, or are metabolized by those enzymes are not expected.
Dual Blockade of the Renin-Angiotensin System (RAS)

sentence.text: Closely monitor blood pressure, renal function and electrolytes in patients on Azor and other agents that affect the RAS.
Do not co-administer aliskiren with Azor in patients with diabetes [See Contraindications (4)].
Avoid use of aliskiren with Azor in patients with renal impairment (GFR <60 ml/min).
Concurrent administration of bile acid sequestering agent colesevelam hydrochloride reduces the systemic exposure and peak plasma concentration of olmesartan.

mmtx.phraseText: Concurrent administration of bile acid sequestering agent colesevelam hydrochloride
Concurrent administration of bile acid sequestering agent colesevelam hydrochloride
Concurrent administration of bile acid sequestering agent colesevelam hydrochloride
Concurrent administration of bile acid sequestering agent colesevelam hydrochloride
Concurrent administration of bile acid sequestering agent colesevelam hydrochloride
Concurrent administration of bile acid sequestering agent colesevelam hydrochloride

sentence.text: Administration of olmesartan at least 4 hours prior to colesevelam hydrochloride decreased the drug interaction effect.
Consider administering olmesartan at least 4 hours before the colesevelam hydrochloride dose
